CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy prosecutor of the GPE Regional prosecutor ’s office informed the applicant that there were no reasons to set aside the decision of CARDINAL DATE . In the meantime , on DATE the applicant requested the President of ORG ( renamed the Sergiyev ORG after the town of PERSON had been renamed ORG ) to restore the case file regarding his employment dispute and to pursue its examination of his claims against ORG . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively ORG forwarded to ORG repeated requests by the applicant for restoration of the case file ( заявление о восстановлении утраченного судебного производства ) with a view to proceeding with the examination of his employment dispute , further to the decision of DATE . It appears that no action was taken in response to the above requests .

CARDINAL . By decision of DATE , ORG refused to examine the applicant ’s requests to restore the case file , as formulated in his application of DATE and a telegram of CARDINAL DATE respectively . The court referred to the ongoing criminal proceedings and held that it could not examine the applicant ’s requests until his exculpation .

CARDINAL . By letter of CARDINAL DATE , ORG of GPE advised the applicant that the ORG of ORG had forwarded his request for restoration of the case file to ORG for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . By decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG refused to restore the case file concerning the applicant ’s employment dispute . The court noted that it had returned to the applicant the documents lodged in DATE after the decision of DATE had become legally binding . The applicant had not complied with the court ’s requests to re - submit them . Instead of rectifying the shortcomings , the applicant had chosen to complain to higher courts , declaring that the documents were already with ORG . In the absence of the relevant documents and any intention on the part of the applicant to submit them , it had to terminate the proceedings . It advised the applicant that it was open to him to re - submit his employment dispute to ORG .

CARDINAL . It appears that the applicant was not present at the hearing and was not served with a copy of the decision of CARDINAL DATE . The decision was not appealed against and became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant renewed his request to ORG to restore his case file and to adjudicate his employment dispute .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request . It noted that the applicant had asked it to restore the file and had submitted copies of documents related to his employment dispute . However , those documents had not been duly certified . They had been partly typewritten and partly handwritten by the applicant , which cast doubt on their authenticity . The applicant had not submitted any other documents and the court itself had been unable to obtain any documents . PERSON had been declared insolvent . DATE had passed since the case file had been stolen and the applicant had requested to restore it only in DATE . It was impossible to examine authentic written exhibits ( evidence ) related to the applicant ’s labour action . The court finally noted that it was open to the applicant to re - submit his employment dispute to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision . It appears that the applicant was provided with both decisions in due time .
